lessons.title: Main Entryway
lessons.explanation: The Biltmore house is a Chateau built for George Washington Vanderbilt between 1889 and 1895 and is the largest privately owned house in the united states.  Still owned by George Vanderbilt's descendants, it remains one of the most prominent examples of Gilded Age mansions.

lessons.title: Billiard Room
lessons.explanation: As a grandson of famed industrialist and philanthropist Cornelius Vanderbilt, George takes his place among one of Americas best-known families. George Vanderbilt first visits Asheville, North Carolina in 1887. He considers the area as a possible location for his country home

lessons.title: Banquet Room
lessons.explanation: Vanderbilts 250-room French Renaissance chateau is a true marvel, the largest undertaking in residential architecture. Over a six-year period, an entire community of craftsmen comes together to create Americas premier home and the environmental wonderland that surrounds it

lessons.title: Mr. Vanderbilt's Room
lessons.explanation: In 1900, Cornelia Vanderbilt is born at Biltmore. George and Ediths only child is born on the evening of August 22 in the Louis XV Room. It is a celebrity birth, even by modern standards

lessons.title: A Day in the Life
lessons.explanation: Vanderbilts 250-room French Renaissance chateau is a true marvel, the largest undertaking in residential architecture. Over a six-year period, an entire community of craftsmen comes together to create Americas premier home and the environmental wonderland that surrounds it

lessons.title: Just Past the Vegetable Pantry
lessons.explanation: On Christmas Eve, the country retreat George Vanderbilt has spent so long planning is marvelously decorated and full of festivity. The finished home contains over four acres of floor space, including 35 bedrooms, 43 bathrooms, and 65 fireplaces

test.description: What you know about the Biltmore?

questions.content: Which Vanderbilt was the house built for?
How many fireplaces are at the Biltmore?
The Biltmore is still privately owned by the Vanderbilt family
What was the name of George and Edith's Only Child, born at the Biltmore
Where is the Vanderbilt Family Mausoleum
How many years did it take to finish building the Biltmore
On what holiday did the Vanderbilts open the Biltmore
What room was used to store famous art during World War II?
